float BM_edge_calc_face_angle ( BMEdge *  e)

BMESH EDGE/FACE ANGLE.

Calculates the angle between two faces. Assumes the face normals are correct.

Returns:
angle in radians

BMESH EDGE/FACE TANGENT.

Calculate the tangent at this loop corner or fallback to the face normal on straignt lines. This vector always points inward into the face.

e
e_loopThe loop to calculate the tangent at, used to get the face and winding direction.

void BM_edge_ordered_verts_ex ( BMEdge *  edge,
BMVert **  r_v1,
BMVert **  r_v2,
BMLoop *  edge_loop 
)

Returns the verts of an edge as used in a face if used in a face at all, otherwise just assign as used in the edge.

Useful to get a deterministic winding order when calling BM_face_create_ngon() on an arbitrary array of verts, though be sure to pick an edge which has a face.

Note:
This is infact quite a simple check, mainly include this function so the intent is more obvious. We know these 2 verts will _always_ make up the loops edge

Definition at line 751 of file bmesh_queries.c.

References BLI_assert, BMLoop::e, BMLoop::next, and BMLoop::v.

int BM_face_exists_multi ( BMVert **  varr,
BMEdge **  earr,
int  len 
)

Given a set of vertices and edges (varr, earr), find out if all those vertices are filled in by existing faces that _only_ use those vertices.

This is for use in cases where creating a face is possible but would result in many overlapping faces.

An example of how this is used: when 2 tri's are selected that share an edge, pressing Fkey would make a new overlapping quad (without a check like this)

earr and varr can be in any order, however they _must_ form a closed loop.

Definition at line 1026 of file bmesh_queries.c.

Referenced by BM_face_exists_multi_edge().

BMLoop* BM_face_other_edge_loop ( BMFace *  f,
BMEdge *  e,
BMVert *  v 
)

Other Loop in Face Sharing an Edge.

Finds the other loop that shares v with e loop in f.

+----------+ | | | f | | | +----------+ <-- return the face loop of this vertex. v --> e ^ ^ <------- These vert args define direction in the face to check. The faces loop direction is ignored.

Definition at line 69 of file bmesh_queries.c.

References BMLoop::e, BMLoop::f, BMEdge::l, BMLoop::next, BMLoop::prev, BMLoop::radial_next, and BMLoop::v.

Referenced by bmw_IslandboundWalker_step(), bmw_LoopWalker_step(), crazyspace_set_quats_editmesh(), createSlideVerts(), edbm_rip_invoke__edge(), edbm_rip_invoke__vert(), edgering_find_order(), and get_next_loop().

BMLoop* BM_face_other_vert_loop ( BMFace *  f,
BMVert *  v_prev,
BMVert *  v 
)

Other Loop in Face Sharing a Vertex.

Finds the other loop in a face.

This function returns a loop in f that shares an edge with v The direction is defined by v_prev, where the return value is the loop of what would be 'v_next'

+----------+ <-- return the face loop of this vertex. | | | f | | | +----------+ v_prev --> v ^^^^^^ ^ <-- These vert args define direction in the face to check. The faces loop direction is ignored.

Note:
v_prev and v _implicitly_ define an edge.

Definition at line 109 of file bmesh_queries.c.

References BLI_assert, BM_edge_exists(), BM_ITER_ELEM, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT, BMLoop::f, BMLoop::next, NULL, BMLoop::prev, and BMLoop::v.

Referenced by BM_edge_calc_rotate(), BM_edge_rotate_check(), BM_edge_rotate_check_degenerate(), BM_loop_other_vert_loop(), bmw_LoopWalker_step(), and edbm_rip_edge_side_measure().

int BM_vert_is_manifold ( BMVert *  v)

A vertex is non-manifold if it meets the following conditions: 1: Loose - (has no edges/faces incident upon it). 2: Joins two distinct regions - (two pyramids joined at the tip). 3: Is part of a an edge with more than 2 faces. 4: Is part of a wire edge.

Definition at line 519 of file bmesh_queries.c.

References bmesh_disk_edge_next(), bmesh_radial_length(), BMLoop::e, BMVert::e, FALSE, if(), BMEdge::l, len(), BMLoop::next, NULL, BMLoop::prev, BMLoop::radial_next, TRUE, and BMLoop::v.

BMEdge* BM_vert_other_disk_edge ( BMVert *  v,
BMEdge *  e_first 
)

The function takes a vertex at the center of a fan and returns the opposite edge in the fan. All edges in the fan must be manifold, otherwise return NULL.

Note:
This could (probably) be done more effieiently.
